entries.summary: The time it takes from input to output.

Binary Coded Decimal - A format for representing decimal numbers with binary, where each digit is 4 bits long.
Example: 123 in BCD -> 0001 0010 0011
The Base 16 number system. In minecraft, this term is synonymous with signal strength because there are 16 signal strength values (0-15).

The time it takes before a circuit is ready for another input. 
For example: If a circuit can accept a new input every 2 ticks, you may see this written as "2 tick pipelinable", or "5 hz" (5 per se...

Includes memory or state. The output is the result of the input AND a memory element.
For example, a counter is sequential. When the "count" input is pressed, the output depends on what is already ...

No memory or state. The output is the result of the input alone. 
For example, an adder is combinational. For a given input, it will always produce the same output.

A format for representing both positive and negative numbers in binary that allows addition to work as expected.
Example: 1001 (-7) + 0101 (5) = 1110 (-2) 
Learn more: https://www.geeksforgeeks.org...

Refers to one bit of a binary string being active at a time.
Examples: 00001000, 1000000, 000100

High speed memory in a device strategically used to reduce read and write times by only storing a part of the memory at once.

Refers to a form of data transfer where less wires are used to transfer more data: Each bit is sent one after the other. One wire can be used to transfer an infinite amount of data.

A buffer for displays which allows a device to write to a display without the new data being instantly shown on the display. This allows full frames to be written to a screen at once.

A wire or collection of wires which transfer data from one place to another

LIFO: A data structure where the last input is outputted first (LIFO, Last in first out).

Sync: All input values take the same amount of time to reach the output, no matter the input.

The lowest level programming language possible for a specific computer. This can often be translated directly into binary (machine code).

A logic gate equivalent to A and (not B), commonly used in redstone since it describes a comparator on subtract mode (the back input is A, and the side input is B)

MSB: The most significant bit, the bit that has the most value in a binary value.

A latch made typically out of two NOR gates pointing into each other, with two inputs, Set and Reset, and typically two outputs, Q and Q' (not Q).

Pulsing the "set" sets Q to 1, and Q' to 0

A latch with two inputs: One for data and one for clock.

When clock is pulsed, the state of the latch is set to the data.

**Bit**: The smallest unit of data, representing a 0 or a 1 in binary. Abbreviated as b
